alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 23 at 5:00PM EST until December 24 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas. * WHERE...Ocean and Coastal Ocean. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels have dropped below flood stage across the oceanfront and inlets. As a result, the coastal flood warnings have been allowed to expire for these areas. The exception is Barnegat Bay. Because of the onshore flow we saw ahead of the Arctic cold front, the bay is still draining slowly. Tidal piling occurred earlier. As a result, up to two feet of inundation above ground level can still be expected across low-lying areas as we move through the evening.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
